definition: in two minds about sth (idiom)/half-hearted/shilly-shallying
surname San
three/3
heart/mind/intention/center/core/CL:顆|颗[ke1],個|个[ge4]
two/2/(Beijing dialect) stupid
Italy/Italian/abbr. for 意大利[Yi4 da4 li4]
idea/meaning/thought/to think/wish/desire/intention/to expect/to anticipate

sentences.english: I didn't realize my boyfriend was two-timing me.
sentences.chinese: 我不知道我的男朋友對我三心二意。

sentences.english: Half-heartedness in an entrepreneurial endeavor will chip away at your drive to succeed.
sentences.chinese: 在創業過程中三心二意，將讓你失去成功的動力。

sentences.english: Jim was of two minds and absent-mindedness at class this morning.
sentences.chinese: 今天早上吉姆上課時三心二意，心不在焉。

sentences.english: This is not work for the half-hearted or easily-discouraged.
sentences.chinese: 三心二意或容易氣餒是不行的。

sentences.english: However, reforms have often been halfhearted.
sentences.chinese: 但改革經常是三心二意的。

sentences.english: In the game of emotional counterfeit, you think you're my match?
sentences.chinese: 三心二意貌合神離你是我對手嗎？

sentences.english: Rarely do we hear that someone is playing the field or dating several people.
sentences.chinese: 我們很少聽到有人三心二意或同時和幾個人約會。

definition: lit. say three in the morning but four in the evening (idiom); to change sth that is already settled upon/indecisive/to blow hot and cold
to change at once on seeing sth different (idiom); loving fads and novelty/never satisfied with what one has
concentrating one's thoughts and efforts/single-minded/bent on/intently
serve Qin in the morning Chu in the evening (idiom); quick to switch sides
to give up halfway (idiom); leave sth unfinished
single-minded/concentrated
to concentrate on
to do two things at once (idiom)/to multitask/to divide one's attention
to act impetuously (idiom); on an impulse
indecisive/irresolute
brief period of enthusiasm/flash in the pan
to start but not finish (idiom); to fail to carry things through/lack of sticking power/short attention span
to look forward and back/to consider prudently/overcautious
to bite off more than one can chew (idiom)/to aim too high
to multitask
faithful unto death (i.e. Confucian ban on widow remarrying)
